heaviest_rainfall.status: On 04 January 2025, a record rainfall of 36.8mm was measured, indicating an exceptionally wet day.  4.6mm per hour was recorded as falling at times during the 37.2 hour storm.

heaviest_rainrate.status: A torrential downpour occurred on 02 September 2025 when the rain reached a maximum intensity of 27.0mm per hour.  This happened during a 15.0 hour storm when 21.19mm of rain fell.

longest_rain.status: The record duration for continuous rain was set on 04 January 2025, the storm lasted 37.2 hours with a total precipitation of 36.8mm and it reached 4.6mm per hour at times.

most_lightning.status: Since records began on 11 April 2025, the highest lightning strike count in one day is 23 on 07 September 2025.

storm.status: No storms are expected.  The last storm was observed on 13 October 2025 and continued for 1 day.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: There is currently no cold snap.  This year there have been 6 cold snaps, usually there are 3.7 cold snaps per year.

extreme.status: The largest temperature difference recorded was 26.7°C on 29 April 2025.  On that date the temperature reached 27.1°C and fell to 0.4°C.

heatwaves.status: There is currently no heatwaves.  This year there have been 6 heatwavess, usually there are 1.9 heatwavess per year.

tropical.status: The last tropical night was on 18 July 2025 and it has only happened 62 times since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is southerly (188°).  In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: 93.7 mph is the largest wind gust recorded on 13 October 2012.

run.status: To date, the maximum wind run recorded is 1737 miles on 21 October 2012.

speed.status: 93.7 mph is the largest wind speed recorded on 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description: The past week and month had observable variation in cloud levels (up 491 m), light levels (up 2530 lux), and dew point temperature (down 1.8°C) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 205.9m higher than yesterday, 218.6m lower than the past week, 490.6m lower than the past month.

The cloud levels for yesterday ranged from 624m to 1149m and averaged 1095.7m, while the past week and month indicated warmer conditions.

summary.summary: Inside; comfortable and pleasant temperatures. Outside; pleasant, mild temperatures. Also, air will feel comfortable and balanced and winds will be practically absent. Chance of light rain, cloud cover will be variable, overcast at times, and periods of sunshine are expected. Weather should be calm and steady.

washing.phrase: The humidity is too high (88%) for your washing to dry quickly.  Any drying will take longer than usual.
